when running our test we get an npe (stack lower)

it is due to the fact that field

in org.eclipse.jface.resource.FontRegistry::handleDisplayDispose()

suggest to empty the listener collection rather than nulling it out completely.

I have made the suggested change (also added clear() to ListenerList).

However, this suggests that the recent changes to display dispose processing in 
SWT are breaking.  Should dispose widgets before display dispose.  Need extra 
callback to handle shutdown (with cancel).

The change that is causing this problem has been backed out but unfortunately, 
not for M5.  The actual problem in SWT has nothing to do with "extra callback 
to handle shutdown".  It was caused by some (bogus) changes I made while in the 
vicinity.  Sorry about that!
